speaker: Alice
content: Susan Mayer, who lives across the street, brought macaroni and cheese.
mark: across the street 在街对面或者到达街对面

speaker: Alice
content: Her husband, Carl, always teased her about her macaroni, saying it was the only thing she knew how to cook and she rarely made it well.
mark: tease 取笑，嘲笑；逗弄  tease her about her work

speaker: Alice
content: It was too salty the night she and Carl moved into their house.

speaker: Alice
content: It was too watery the night she found lipstick on Carl's shirt.
mark: watery 水的；淡的；湿的；松软的
lipstick 口红，唇膏 lip 嘴唇  stick 粘，贴；

speaker: Alice
content: She burned it the night Carl told her he was leaving her for his secretary.
mark: burn 燃烧，消耗；烧坏，烧毁，烧焦；过去式和过去分词：burnt或burned

speaker: Alice
content: A year had passed since the divorce.

speaker: Alice
content: Susan has started to think how nice it would be to have a man in her life.

speaker: Alice
content: Even one who would make fun of her cooking.
mark: Even one who... 即使是一个……的人，如Even one who has a lot of experience may make mistakes
make fun of 嘲笑，取笑

speaker: Julie
content: Mom, why would someone kill themselves?

speaker: Susan
content: Well, sometimes people are so unhappy, they think that's the only way they can solve their problems.

speaker: Julie
content: But Mrs. Young always seemed happy.

speaker: Susan
content: Yeah, sometimes people pretend to be one way on the outside when they're totally different on the inside.

speaker: Julie
content: Are you meaning, like, how dad's girlfriend is always smiling, says nice things, but deep down, you just know she's a bitch.
mark: are you meaning... 询问对方是不是在指某件事 == Do you mean
says nice things 说好听的话
deep down 实际上；在心底

speaker: Susan
content: I don't like that word, Julie. But, yeah, that's a great example.
